blog.title: jonsa
blog.description:
«i'll protect you, I promise»
inst: @sansaxjon

summary: they do remind to Jon that his cousin has been psychologically, physically and sexually abused and then at the same time turn...
body:
they do remind to Jon that his cousin has been psychologically, physically and sexually abused and then at the same time turn Sansa to accept her pain all along, go through it’s deep and finally starting letting it go. I’ve considered it as a demonstration of self-psychoanalysis of hers, some victims with traumas like that come to it at their time. I’ve been through smth like this and, i suppose, i can recognise it somehow.

whatever. the meaning is that:

(a) he’s hurt when Dany said those words: «not after the things they’ve done to her»

(b) he’s the one of the family who’s dropped to all the things Sansa’s been through. not once, already twice: Ramsay gave him a gloaty hint and Dany just tried to convince him that Sansa’s the power-hungry bitch now.

© these scenes with mentioning Sansa’s painful past lead somewhere. will Jon think about it more since now? will he be more gentle the way he treats her? more accurate?

idk guys, what’s your opinion on this?

[gifs belong to @humblemagic ❤️]

blog.name: culturalrebel

blog.description: 32. Lagos. A most likely rambling and random collection of thoughts, things I like and very decisive opinions. Also known as Professor Wrestletrash.

summary: “I wish you’d never told me. If I didn’t know I’d be happy right now. I try to forget. Tonight I did for a while and then I saw...
text:
“I wish you’d never told me. If I didn’t know I’d be happy right now. I try to forget. Tonight I did for a while and then I saw them gathered around you. I saw the way they looked at you. I know that look. So many people have looked at me that way, but never here. Never on this side of the sea.”

It’s a soliloquy that might feature Emilia Clarke’s most poignant and understated acting of her career. It’s so soft. So delicate. She’s so desperately alone and she needs him so badly. Why can’t he see that?

“I told you I don’t want it.” He growls back at her. Thick and low and missing every point.

And now Daenerys has to drive the point home because this bumpkin cannot grasp it.

“It doesn’t matter what you want. You didn’t want to be King in the North. What happens when they demand you press your claim and take what is mine?”

He’s shocked by this. Because he’s so idealistic and never sees the inherent greed and evil in men. I have always loved Jon Snow for this innocence and this nobility and this belief in his fellow men.

But now it’s dangerous to Daenerys. It’s foolhardy. But he doesn’t know that. There is no duplicity at play and because of that, this scene actually works. Two characters have goal which cannot intersect peacefully. He needs above all else, to be a Stark. To be Ned’s son. And to hold to the familial values that he was raised upon.

And she knows the minds of men. She knows that for some reason, she is not the sovereign that Westeros wants. She has seen it first hand. She isn’t making this up. It’s not a paranoia or a delusion. Her dream is slipping away and the main culprit, unintentionally, is kneeling in front of her, too daft to see the obvious writing on the wall. Daenerys has already done the math, but Jon can’t add.

[…….]

And this is the moment where we know it’s over. Because if this is Ygritte? Jon keeps that secret. I would bet my bottom dollar on it. If Ygritte asks him for this one favor, he says yes. But the bonds with Dany, even though the show would have us believe that they’re stronger, have been weakened by the revelation of his ancestry and the wrongness of their love.

“It won’t” He says.

“It will.”

She is flooded with emotion. He’s not going to understand. She’s losing this battle. It’s so difficult to watch.

She takes him by the shoulders now. Voice heavy with sadness, and she plays her last card. Something she’s never before done in her whole life.

SHE BEGS.

She begs this oaf to listen and to trust her.

She begs him to understand and to love her again, the way he did before he knew.

She begs for the door to a future to reopen. A future where they both can find true happiness.

“I’ve never begged for anything. But I’m begging you. Don’t do this. Please.”

If it’s Ygritte, this conversation is over. Probably with a few threats to remove his testicles from his body for good measure. But even begging hasn’t worked for Daenerys. The most powerful woman in the Known World, reduced to a beggar, for love for destiny and for her very survival.

And Jon doesn’t get it.

It’s the angriest I’ve ever been at him. Not because I have the capacity to turn my back on him. In that I’m as stupid as he is. But because this is just a girl asking a boy to love her. This isn’t about the goddamn Seven Kingdoms or some chair somewhere. This about them, their love and their future.

And he’s not with her.

Jon puts her face in his mits and he tells her “you are my queen, nothing will change that. And they are my family, we can live together.”

He smiles.

She does not. Because she has begged and he has still refused her.

And that brings out an ancient coldness in her. Again, not some manufactured Mad Queen asinine horseshit. True coldness for a man who doesn’t have her fucking back. After all this. After she changed the world for him and saved him from ruin, personally, on multiple occasions. This fucking boor. This self important douchebag. He would be dead a dozen times over without her. And he still will not listen. Her coldness, her icy anger is warranted.
source: Game of Thrones Season 8 Episode 4 Recap: Last of the Starks

reblog.comment: Game of Thrones Season 8 Episode 4 Recap: Last of the Starks

Jon suddenly remembers he abandoned Ghost, and the last ep is Homeward Bound 3: Bound for the Wall, a charming and heartwarming tale of one very stupid boy trying to get home to his faithful and beloved dog.

summary: How do you think Ned felt about Jon taking the black knowing he was giving up his claim on the throne? Happy it would remove him...
question: How do you think Ned felt about Jon taking the black knowing he was giving up his claim on the throne? Happy it would remove him from danger?
answer:
Hello!

We will never know his plans for if Jon grew up not having taken the black. Ned fully respected the Baratheon line and wanted it to pass to Stannis after Robert’s death when he left no true heirs behind. He always stated Stannis as the rightful ruler and if he had gotten his way, Stannis would have sat there for many years and after this his children. Didn’t look like there was much room for Jon in that plan.

I don’t think he was happy per say, but the Watch was an honorable cause for the Starks and at least Benjen was there to teach Jon what it meant to be a man. We know he was going to tell Jon who his real mother was had they been reunited so since Jon was safe having taken the black, at the very least it could have been a relief for him.

summary: If Sansa’s not kidnapped what do you think means Jon kneeling in front of Cersei in the photos? Any idea? Wanna read your...
question: If Sansa’s not kidnapped what do you think means Jon kneeling in front of Cersei in the photos? Any idea? Wanna read your thoughts!
answer:
Well, assuming those were actual scenes that made it into the season…

If it’s not kidnap related, maybe Jon realizes Dany is really hecking close to abandoning their plans and attacking the city anyway, and he enters the city to treat with Cersei and think up a plan to stop Dany because Jon doesn’t want thousands of civilians to die.

Or the siege plans were always a way for him to end up in a position where he could try and work something out with Cersei. He did want to talk to her at the Dragonpit. Perhaps he thinks he could negotiate a deal of some sort. Sure, Cersei can’t be trusted and he definitely knows that, but Cersei also don’t want to see her home burn.

Or he decides to go on a suicide mission, just like when he headed out to kill Mance. He figures he could end this war and save the citizens of King’s Landing if he only kills Cersei. Although, killing Dany should be easier, I suppose. 

Idk, anon. I’ve for a long while assumed that this whole pol!jon thing would eventually lead to Jon repeating his s5 storyline, where he had to be a mediator and juggle the Night’s Watch (his family), the Free Folk (his enemies-turned-allies), and Stannis (the person thinking he’s the rightful ruler). And that would mean that maybe he’d need to turn Cersei into an ally, since Dany definitely is the Stannis in this situation. Only that this time, Jon won’t end up murdered for it because he learned his lesson. And perhaps this time, his family will come to his aid when he needs them the most and show him that he’s not alone? 

The fact that Cersei wore black there, though, and she’s been in red lately… Idk. I’m not so sure the photos are from actual scenes.

summary: I finally gave in and read the Game of Thrones leaks
body:
I finally gave in and read the Game of Thrones leaks

First of all, they got it right up to E4 right, at least with important stuff, so I do believe it is right. I haven’t read all of it and I’m not gonna reveal a thing about it, but now I know what happens to Sansa, Jon and Daenerys, and I got… A mixture of emotions, equally bad and good.

I’m basically only watching the show because I invested too much time to give up on it and because of Sansa, but I honestly don’t really care as much about it as I once did.

If anyone wants to ask anything, just send me a chat, I’m not gonna spoil it to anyone before the airing of the episode.

Ps: The leaks were from reddit.

tags: it breaks my heart to think about him witnessing this
summary:
Imagine what Ned Stark would say about what they are doing to Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen. 
Two children of a line he was...
body:
Imagine what Ned Stark would say about what they are doing to Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen.

Two children of a line he was sworn to oppose, yet one he raised to become as honorable as himself and the other he didn’t know, but defended from afar. Both, he protected until his dying day.

What would the most honorable man have to say about how the character of the last Targaryens has been violated?

summary:
(gif made by @tiny-little-bird)
To people who’ve read leaks: Has there been any mention of Jon and Cersei possibly interacting?...
body:
(gif made by @tiny-little-bird)

To people who’ve read leaks: Has there been any mention of Jon and Cersei possibly interacting? If so, under what circumstances? These pictures are haunting me and I really want to know what’s going on and how it relates to the rest of the Jon/Dany leaks. Can someone please help a girl out if they got any info?
